Posts.Content: Julie_1958 wrote: Last February I was here because my annual mammo and follow up ultrasound showed a 6x6x2mm lesion.  My christmas tree shaped lesion was higher than wider, had shadowing, so off I was sent for the biopsy.  Results came back B9.   :)   The end of this month I am scheduled for the mammo and the ultrasound and am scared all over again.  Like a fool I pulled out all the papers from last year and the oncology notes from my mothers 16 year battle with BC.  Yeah, sometimes too much info is not a good thing.  Just wanted to connect with those that understand, I have not shared with my family my scheduled appointment, no reason in all of us worrying.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Here I am again, 1 year later Julie_1958 puddingirl84

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2010 04:56PM Julie_1958 wrote: Thank you ladies for your kindness, you saved my sanity last year and you are doing it again this year.  As you all know the waiting is the worse, thinking they should put us in a deep sleep until all testing and results are complete.  :)  Lisa, my mother was 56 years old when 1st dx, 2nd dx 6 years later, 3rd dx 3 years later, and then the final one took her.  Her sister also had breast cancer but was in her late 70's when dx.    Keeping you all in my thoughts and prayers.
Posts.Title: Here I am again, 1 year later Julie_1958 puddingirl84

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 04:46PM Julie_1958 wrote: You are not alone.  Tomorrow before you go for your appointment write our names on a piece of paper stick in your pants pocket, take us with you.  We will all be thinking of you tomorrow.  ((hugs))
